message.content:
cs.CV, cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.NA. 

The paper deals with image denoising, which is a common problem in computer vision and image processing. The use of lp regression in the Non-Local Means (NLM) algorithm is a technique that falls under the category of image restoration and enhancement, which is a subfield of computer vision. Therefore, cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) is the most likely sub-category. 

The paper also discusses the use of an iteratively reweighted least-squares (IRLS) algorithm for solving the regression problem in NLPR. This algorithm falls under the category of optimization, which is a common theme in many subfields of computer science. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory), cs.LG (Machine Learning), and cs.NA (Numerical Analysis) are also likely sub-categories. 

Finally, the paper presents numerical experiments to demonstrate the performance of the NLPR algorithm, which involves the use of computational techniques and algorithms. Therefore, cs.MM (Multimedia) is also a possible sub-category.
